name: sort
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of things that are of the same type or that share similar qualities

example.eg: We both like the same sort of music.
example.egtrans: 我们俩喜欢同一类音乐。

example.eg: I'm going to have a salad of some sort.
What sort of shoes will I need?
example.egtrans: 我需要什么样的鞋子呢？

example.eg: We saw all sorts (= many types) of animals in the park.
example.egtrans: 我们在公园里看见了各种各样的动物。

example.eg: Many sorts of bacteria are resistant to penicillin.
example.egtrans: 有很多种细菌能抵抗青霉素。

example.eg: This sort of camera is very expensive.
Plants of this sort need shady conditions.
example.egtrans: 这种植物需要在阴凉的环境下生长。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the type of thing or person that you like

example.eg: Hmm, this is my sort of wine!
example.egtrans: 嗯，这是我喜欢的葡萄酒！

example.eg: I'd have thought these black trousers were more your sort of thing.
example.egtrans: 我本以为这条黑色裤子才是你喜欢的那种。

example.eg: I wouldn't have thought he was your sort (= was the type of man you would be attracted to).
example.egtrans: 我没想到你喜欢他这种类型。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to show that what you have just said is only an example from a much larger group of things

example.eg: They sell souvenirs, postcards, that sort of thing.
example.egtrans: 他们卖纪念品、明信片之类的东西。

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person having the stated or suggested character

example.eg: He seemed like a decent sort to me.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，他似乎是很正派的那种人。

name: sort
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a number of things in an order or to separate them into groups

example.eg: Paper, plastic, and cans are sorted for recycling.
example.egtrans: 纸张、塑料和罐子分开归类以便回收。

example.eg: I'm going to sort these old books into those to be kept and those to be thrown away.
example.egtrans: 我打算把这些旧书分成要留下的和要扔掉的两类。

example.eg: You can use the computer to sort the newspaper articles alphabetically, by date, or by subject.
example.egtrans: 你可以用电脑把这些报刊文章按字母顺序、日期或主题进行排列。

example.eg: She found the ring while sorting (through) some clothes.
example.egtrans: 她在整理衣服时找到了那枚戒指。

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with something by repairing or organizing it

example.eg: Can you sort the car by tomorrow?
example.egtrans: 你明天能把汽车修好吗？

example.eg: We must get the phone sorted soon.
example.egtrans: 我们必须马上找人把电话修好。

example.eg: I must get this paperwork sorted before I go on holiday next week.
example.egtrans: 我下星期度假之前必须把这些文书工作处理完。
